text:
# Incident Report

## Incident
Billings have drastically slowed down at 07.19 6AM CET.
Aki noticed it on the dashboard this morning, a full day later.

## Symptoms
Billing backend took about 50 minutes to run a full loop of billings on our users.
Reading and submitting txs timed out, or took 20-30 seconds to run. Validator node was throwing errors.

## Cause
After a lot of digging, it became evident that the database pod of our k8s cluster is overloaded/throttling.
Based on resource usage metrics and the times, it was obviously related to the recently installed and started ChataAI backend and our user onboardings 12 hours before the Incident.

## Solution
We turned off chata-ai backend service on the cluster.

## Notes
Before we knew the root cause, we experimented with the following solutions:
• Parallel requests to the API. Obviously caused even more throttling
• Removed all users whose balance is known to be zero from the env config. This is still in effect.
## Next steps
• We are talking with IEU to scale our pods up, to facilitate Chata AI if we want to.
• We need better monitoring/alerting. This incident would have been 'hard' to catch, as nothing was 'erroring' mostly, just being terribly slow for a while. However, the 503 Errors from the Billing app in the end stages could have triggered PagerDuty alerts.

elements.text:
# Incident Report

## Incident
Billings have drastically slowed down at 07.19 6AM CET.
Aki noticed it on the dashboard this morning, a full day later.

## Symptoms
Billing backend took about 50 minutes to run a full loop of billings on our users.
Reading and submitting txs timed out, or took 20-30 seconds to run. Validator node was throwing errors.

## Cause
After a lot of digging, it became evident that the database pod of our k8s cluster is overloaded/throttling.
Based on resource usage metrics and the times, it was obviously related to the recently installed and started ChataAI backend and our user onboardings 12 hours before the Incident.

## Solution
We turned off chata-ai backend service on the cluster.

## Notes
Before we knew the root cause, we experimented with the following solutions:
Parallel requests to the API. Obviously caused even more throttling
Removed all users whose balance is known to be zero from the env config. This is still in effect.
## Next steps
We are talking with IEU to scale our pods up, to facilitate Chata AI if we want to.

We need better monitoring/alerting. This incident would have been 'hard' to catch, as nothing was 'erroring' mostly, just being terribly slow for a while. However, the 503 Errors from the Billing app in the end stages could have triggered PagerDuty alerts.

text:
Nice report, thanks <@U088UV6MKFE>.

I'm guessing it was mentioned already, but I'd recommend we get some monitoring and alerting up before we reactivate chata, and before we ask IEU to make any changes.

elements.text: Nice report, thanks

.

I'm guessing it was mentioned already, but I'd recommend we get some monitoring and alerting up before we reactivate chata, and before we ask IEU to make any changes.

text:
Actually, since this is so critical and we've got other manual ways to create parties, I would recommend we throw up some basic monitoring before we launch anything else including the self-service app. 

It could be as simple as an API that checks the number of transfers in the last 10 minutes and make sure it's roughly the right number. And calls a pager duty alert if needed. For the simplest solution, it could even be bundled into our current health check stack

text: <@U093Q4FPEJG> <@U088UV6MKFE>

I apologize everyone I didn't have slack notifications turned on. Fixed now. 

But good job resolving! I left some comments on the incident report, thanks Robert for posting that. Not an easy one to have predicted at all. But important lesson learned about installing apps in the Canton ecosystem.

text:

Another thought <@U088UV6MKFE> would be to do that system backup, so we can recover if needed. Might be nice to walk through it with <@U093Q4FPEJG> together for knowledge sharing

text:
Yep,

So as a quick fix I just deployed LogTail as an Add-on to the canton-billing-backend. It aggregates the logs in a searchable, transformable format. So we can get error logs pretty easily. It takes 30$ per month. You can access it by clicking on the link next to the add-on.

Also I added Alerting, sadly the plan only contains one user to send the alerts. Since I'm the most responsible for the service I set myself. I will also notify you when I get the alert. The alert checks the error logs at any point it gets error logs it will trigger. Right now there is a false positive alert, but once I set up the alerting properly I will fix the error.

The LogTail is super-slow. That's why it is a temporary solution. In the future it will make sense to move to AWS.

Also I added Alerting, sadly the plan only contains one user to send the alerts. Since I'm the most responsible for the service I set myself. I will also notify you when I get the alert. The alert checks the error logs at any point it gets error logs it will trigger. Right now there is a false positive alert, but once I set up the alerting properly I will fix the error.

The LogTail is super-slow. That's why it is a temporary solution. In the future it will make sense to move to AWS.

text:
Hey team, I made some updates to the health dashboard tonight, <https://status.dlc.link>

This now pulls canton reward data using the wallet API, similar to Aki’s app. It also draws a chart. It pulls about 1 hour of rewards data every 5 minutes, and sees if there are two rounds with less than 5000 in rewards in a row. if there are, it will call the pagerduty alert.

I wanted to add this to the system Ferenc put in place, as it has pagerduty already built in.

I merged the PR, but here it is for review. <https://github.com/DLC-link/health-dashboard/pull/96> & <https://github.com/DLC-link/health-dashboard/pull/97>

Unfortunately it’s pretty long, cause there was quite a bit of code. But i did some testing.

we can consider how all these alerts and systems play together when we sync up together
